newsitem.title: USA: CB Commercial to merge with Koll.
newsitem.headline: CB Commercial to merge with Koll.

text.p: CB Commercial Real Estate Services Group Inc and Koll Real Estate Services Inc said Tuesday they signed a letter of intent to merge.

Under the terms of the letter of intent, CB Commercial, based in Los Angeles, would exchange approximately six million shares of its common stock for all of the shares of Koll Real Estate Services, based in Newport Beach, Calif., in a tax-free reorganization to be accounted for as a purchase.

The transaction currently is valued at approximately $145 million and is expected to be accretive to 1997 earnings to CB Commercial's shareholders, subsequent to a reserve for one-time integration charges.
Koll is a privately held corporation founded by Don Koll and owned by Don Koll, Koll management, affiliates of Freeman Spogli & Co Inc and Apollo Real Estate Advisors.
The merger does not include several other Koll entities, including Koll Construction, Koll Real Estate Group or Koll International.
The companies said they expect to execute a definitive agreement in April.
